name: places/ChIJI3iV7jlawokRGIVhEkj651U
adrFormatAddress: 60 Furman St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA

editorialSummary.text: Trendy hotel featuring a restaurant & a rooftop bar, plus a gym, a screening room & river views.

originalText.text: I stayed here for 2 nights and was put in a room with a lower Manhattan skyline view and it was great!  The water filter in the room is a very neat idea, the service was great, did not need to wait at all to check-in/out. You can text message the lobby/concierge for any needs which is very convenient. Surrounding area is great, located in one of the best areas in Brooklyn. Rooftop view is a must! Should be noted there is some construction on the north side of the building, if you stay on that side during the week I heard there may be noise.

originalText.text: Absolutely wonderful staff and property! From the time I approached the front door until I checked out, everyone was friendly, helpful and accommodating. The lobby was well appointed and comfortable and the view from my room was outstanding. Plus, the room was clean with in-room filtered water and a very comfortable bed. Additionally, the property is located near restaurants and a riverside park, allowing for easy access to local photo ops and activities. Will definitely stay again. Overall, 10/10 and highly recommend!

text.text: Absolutely wonderful staff and property! From the time I approached the front door until I checked out, everyone was friendly, helpful and accommodating. Overall, 10/10 and highly recommend!

originalText.text: A genuine challenger for some of the cooler hotels in Manhattan. I stayed here just for 1 night but loved the location, views and general vibe of the hotel. And hotel experiences are all about the vibes. The roof bar would be a blast in the summer, but even in the winter, when I was there, the view and photo opportunity of the Brooklyn bridge is worth it alone. I had a chat with the hotel manager at checkout who was a really nice chap to share hotel stories with.

originalText.text:
This hotel is very beautiful, well designed with beautiful combinations of Hard concrete, steel , wood and natural accents of plants. Enjoyed the visual aspect of it. The rooms are also very thoughtfully designed with a lot of beautiful and elegant touches.
Staff was friendly and pleasant, highly recommend staying here very cozy design and sexy lighting through out.
I had a great room with an incredible view of the Brooklyn Bridge, unfortunately the 7AM construction crew on the adjacent lot woke me up from my late night drunken adventures which really mushed my plans to sleep in and get a bit of rest away from home. I wish I would have been informed of that upon check-in then I could have requested a room with a worse view but quieter.

originalText.text:
My boyfriend and I planned to go to a Nets game and wanted to splurge on a nice hotel for one night. We chose 1hotel for their reputation and great location but we were quickly disappointed upon arrival.

We arrived to the hotel 40 minutes before check in and was told we would receive a text message that the room was ready, which would be at their standard at 4pm. At 4:30pm, we still did NOT receive a text message. We approached the front desk again and got told the room was still not inspected.  This signified that our stay was NOT deemed important to the front desk because we didn’t even get our room at the STANDARD time, as told by the first desk lady in a rude cadence when we approached the desk at 3:20pm.

While waiting for our room in the lobby, a bellhop, David, approached my boyfriend to ask what we were waiting for. He made it apparent the only reason he approached us was due to our dogs becoming anxious, not that he truly wanted to help us get upstairs into our room. We waited another 30 minutes until we approached the desk again. They just handed us our keys finally at 5:15pm. The front desk and bellhops did not treat us with the same RESPECT as the couples before us. No one told us what floor, directed us to an elevator, told us how to use the elevator, or offered an apology for the delay. Not even a brief description of the services the hotel had to offer.

Between the delay of getting our room and the clear difference in service, we will never chose to stay here again. To be treated different from the start of the stay is distasteful for any hotel with such high standards
